intro: Arrojadoa penicillata var. decumbens, commonly known as the decumbent arrojadoa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in low-lying, moist areas and has a sprawling, decumbent growth habit. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
